intro: Galium murale f. laeve, commonly known as smooth bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, ascending stems that often grow in dense clusters. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and usually have a smooth texture, which gives it its common name. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
